message_1: A sample of radioactive isotope has an initial activity of 200 Bq. If the half-life of the isotope is 10 days, how much activity will be left after 30 days?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can use the radioactive decay formula:

A = A₀ * (1/2)^(t/T)

where:
A = final activity
A₀ = initial activity
t = time elapsed
T = half-life of the isotope

Given:
A₀ = 200 Bq
T = 10 days
t = 30 days

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

A = 200 * (1/2)^(30/10)

A = 200 * (1/2)^3

A = 200 * (1/8)

A = 25 Bq

After 30 days, the activity of the radioactive isotope will be 25 Bq.
